author: timbeiko
content:
Especially if hasnâ€™t been 24h since the call ðŸ˜… 

There often are many things to do follow up on after ACD that may take priority over the summary (which takes some time to do well!)

author: abcoathup
content:
ACD is the most high profile protocol call.  
Summary of actions/decisions is the key output from protocol calls and should be a priority.  (IMHO)
The community should have this quickly (appreciate it takes time to do well).

Summaries can be really short (e.g. discuss mainnet Pectra date at ACDE after Hoodi upgrade Mar 26, pre-merge history expiry will be after Pectra (rather than May 1), PeerDAS progressing, EIP-7688 (forward compatible consensus data structures) proposed for Fusaka) 

We have only been using Eth Magicians for protocol calls for ~9 months.  Moderators adding summaries by default is not a habit yet (especially outside ACD).
Automated topic creation from ethereum/pm GitHub issues and updating with transcripts & chat logs is still a work in progress.

But point taken, I'll wait for 24 hours after next ACD before asking.  

Really appreciate the job that Tim & Alex do along with other call moderators.

author: timbeiko
content:
> Summaries can be really short (e.g. discuss mainnet Pectra date at ACDE after Hoodi upgrade Mar 26, pre-merge history expiry will be after Pectra (rather than May 1), PeerDAS progressing, EIP-7688 (forward compatible consensus data structures) proposed for Fusaka) 

Right, so there are definitely two ways to do these. When I can manage it, I find it's high ROI to spend the extra time to actually get a more detailed summary, but if it's valuable to have a very high level TL;DR ASAP after the call, I can make that a higher priority.
